result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul J Morrissey

records.addlTxt: Addendum to the 10.10.22 filing

Defendant Paul J Morrissey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Paul J Morrissey.  Attorney Julie Knyszek for Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Review Hearing this date.  Based on the report filed, Court adjourns matter for review prior the expiration date.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records received and filed.  bm
Competency Report received and fled.  bm
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Paul J Morrissey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Paul J Morrissey.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for hearing as to Defendant refusing to take his medication.  Defense and Defendant agree to appearance via Zoom.  Parties stipulate to Dr. Jacqueline Landess' qualifications and her report.  Court took judicial notice as to the criminal complaint.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Jacqueline Landess.  Direct examination.  Cross.  Arguments heard.  Court GRANTS State's request for Involuntary medication.  Court advised Defendant's commitment will expire on November 15, 2022.  Case adjourned for Review Hearing.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion on Medication Order received and filed.  bm
Letter to the Court from Dr. Jacqueline Landess regarding Medication Order Request received and filed.  bm
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records received and filed.  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  No appearance from Attorney Sargent for purposes of rescheduling.  Parties emailed.
AMENDED Order of Commitment for Treatment signed and filed.  bm
Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  bm
Letter to the Court regarding Defendant's custody credit received and filed.  Attorney Sargent emailed this date to calculate the credit.  bm
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  bm

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Paul J Morrissey not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Return on Doctor Report this date.  Defendant REFUSES to leave his cell to come to court.  Dr. Collins report advising Defendant is not competent, but likely to regain not challenged by the parties.  Defense advises as his client refuses to come to Court he stands mute as to the report.  Court adopts the findings of Dr. Collins and orders Defendant transferred to a mental health facility FORTHWITH.  Defendant to be given an opportunity to take his medication prior to being forced.  Defense requests that he be able to forward the Dr. Report to Municipal Court.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned for Status Conference as to voluntarily taking medication.  
  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case adjourned due to Court Down.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 15, 2022, at 8:30 am.
Case calendared for Return On Doctor Report this date.  Defense requests additional time to review report with his client.  Parties agree to July 6, 2022 at 8:30 am.  bm
Competency Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Case calendared for Return on Doctor Report May 23, 2022.  Attorney Sargent in trial and Order for Examination was never sent to the Forensic Unit.  Parties agree to June 24, 2022 at 8:30 am.  Order sent to the Forensic Unit this date.  bm
Received and filed
No Contact Order.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Paul J Morrissey in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Paul J Morrissey in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul J Morrissey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
